word.entryDescription: hair that a man grows on his face.
word.entryExample: My dad is growing a beard.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: very nice to look at
word.entryExample: What a beautiful dress!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of furniture that you sleep on
word.entryExample: I can't sleep on my old bed - I need a new one.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a room for sleeping in
word.entryExample: This is my lovely bedroom.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: earlier than
word.entryExample: I take my dog far a walk before it gets dark.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: at the back of
word.entryExample: Sam is sitting behind Ben.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a long wooden seat
word.entryExample: We sat on a bench in the park.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: used to talk about the person or thing that is the most satisfactory or the highest quality, the comparative of good
word.entryExample: Alex is the best at reading and writing.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the most important friend you have
word.entryExample: Who is your best friend?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: more satisfactory or higher in quality than other similar people or things, the superlative of good
word.entryExample: I'm better at running than swimming.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in the space which separates two things
word.entryExample: The hospital is between the bus station and the park.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: large in size
word.entryExample: Their grandma lives in a big house.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small vehicle with two wheels which you turn by pushing with your feet and legs
word.entryExample: Jill rides her bike in the park.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a container used for putting rubbish in
word.entryExample: Put your paper in the bin.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an animal with feathers and wings that lays eggs and can usually fly
word.entryExample: There's a bird in the tree.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the anniversary of your birth
word.entryExample: How do you celebrate your birthday?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a card with a picture you give somebody on their birthday
word.entryExample: My aunt sent me a funny birthday card.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small, hard cake often eaten as a snack
word.entryExample: Would you like a biscuit with your tea?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is black is the colour of the night sky
word.entryExample: His hair is black.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a cloth cover used on a bed to keep you warm
word.entryExample: We're going camping, bring a warm blanket with you.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: blonde hair is pale yellow or gold
word.entryExample: She's tall and thin, and her hair is long and blonde.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is blue is the colour of the sky
word.entryExample: I've got blue eyes.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a wide flat object often fixed to a wall which a teacher writes on with chalk or a large pen
word.entryExample: Please write your name on the board.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small vehicle we use for travelling on water
word.entryExample: We can sail this boat on the lake.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of furniture with shelves that you keep books in
word.entryExample: We should buy a new bookcase.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not interesting
word.entryExample: I think baseball is boring.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a narrow container we put liquid in, usually made of glass or plastic
word.entryExample: Lucy bought a bottle of milk for the cat.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the lowest part of something
word.entryExample: The cat is sitting at the bottom of the stairs.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to move up and down with small movements
word.entryExample: On the way to the island the plane bounced a lot and I was afraid.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a plate with high sides used to hold food or liquids
word.entryExample: I had a bowl of soup for lunch.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a square or rectangular container you use to store things in
word.entryExample: Can I have a box of chocolates, please?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a food made from flour and water and baked in the oven
word.entryExample: I usually eat bread and jam for breakfast.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the food you eat in the morning
word.entryExample: I have breakfast after I get up.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: extremely clever
word.entryExample: That's brilliant, Lucy!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to take something to or towards the place where you are
word.entryExample: I want to bring Kim a present.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a man or boy who has the same parents as you
word.entryExample: This is my brother Eddie.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is brown is the colour of the earth or chocolate
word.entryExample: I'm wearing a brown hat.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is brown is the colour of the earth or chocolate
word.entryExample: I'm wearing a brown hat.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is brown is the colour of the earth or chocolate
word.entryExample: I'm wearing a brown hat.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to clean your teeth or smooth your hair with a thing called a brush
word.entryExample: Sam must brush his teeth before he goes to bed.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very small animal with lots of legs that often lives on the ground
word.entryExample: Look at these bugs - they're so big!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a structure which normally has walls and a roof
word.entryExample: Big Ben is older than many buildings in New York.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: minced meat made into a flat shape and cooked
word.entryExample: I had a burger and chips for lunch.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a person who drives a bus
word.entryExample: Mr Park works a a bus driver.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place where you can buy tickets and catch a bus
word.entryExample: The bus station is in the centre of the city.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: one of a number of places along a bus route where the bus stops
word.entryExample: There's a bus stop in front of my house.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: when you are busy, you have a lot of things to do
word.entryExample: Mum is busy in the kitchen.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: used to link ideas together that are different from each other
word.entryExample: I like your dog but he's very noisy.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an insect with large, often colourful wings
word.entryExample: Did you see that butterfly flying over the river?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to get something by paying money
word.entryExample: We can buy some vegetables in the market.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to travel on a bike
word.entryExample: Kim goes to school by bike.
word.label: ydp
